newsitem.title: USA: Computer Assocs unveils PC, mainframe link.
newsitem.headline: Computer Assocs unveils PC, mainframe link.

text.p: Giant software maker Computer Associates International Inc on Tuesday unveiled its OPAL package, which adds a user-friendly graphical interface and personal computer attributes to older mainframe systems.

OPAL, developed by Infresco Corp, a newly formed unit of Computer Associates, allows users running "legacy" applications to access data in a multimedia environment, the Islandia, N.Y.-based firm said. It will sell at $995 per copy.
"Legacy" applications are those running on older mainframe, mini-computer and desktop computers where the underlying software is no longer being actively maintained.

"(OPAL will) take old character based systems...and existing files and bring them all together under a user interface that looks and feels like the best user interface you see in games or educational software," CA senior vice president of advanced technology Marc Sokol said.

"This allows organizations to develop highly-individualized business systems that reflect today's cutting edge technology...all without any changes to their workhorse mainframe applications," he added.
OPAL can also build an interface that includes audio greetings and animation sequences, Sokol said.
